sentence.Network_en: Any straggler that fell behind or got lost in the darkness was easy prey for the enemy.
sentence.Network_cn: 任何在黑暗中落伍或走失的掉队者都很容易成为敌人的攻击目标。

sentence.Network_en: I picked up only a straggler from the albacore that were feeding.
sentence.Network_cn: 我只逮住了正在吃小鱼的金枪鱼群中一条失散的.

sentence.Network_en: I knocked out a straggler and I took his place.
sentence.Network_cn: 我宰了他们一个落队的,然后代替了他.

entry.tran: 掉队者;落伍者;拖后腿的人
entry.def: The stragglers are the people in a group who are moving more slowly or making less progress than the others.

example.ex: There were two stragglers twenty yards back...
example.tran: 两名掉队者落后了 20 码。

example.ex: Any straggler that fell behind or got lost in the darkness was easy prey for the enemy.
example.tran: 任何在黑暗中落伍或走失的掉队者都很容易成为敌人的攻击目标。

entry.def: The stragglers at an event such as a party are the people who are still there after most of the other people have left.

example.ex: ...round about two o'clock in the morning when there were only a few stragglers left.
example.tran: 大约在凌晨两点钟只剩下几个人时

means.word_mean: 1. someone who strays or falls behind

auth_sentence.content: Here's why: when surgeons remove a tumor, they inevitably leave behind a few straggler cancer cells.
